title: Choosing Between Sea Salt and Iodized Salt

items.name: Iodized salt
items.details: Best for everyday cooking and seasoning. Provides iodine to prevent deficiency. Flavor difference is negligible once mixed into food.

items.name: Sea salt or kosher salt
items.details: Best for finishing dishes, baking, or when a specific texture or slightly different mineral flavor is desired. Does not add anything essential nutritionally.

items.name: Finishing or texture
items.details: Use sea salt or kosher salt.

notes: The taste and texture differences between salt types are minimal in cooked dishes. The main advantage of iodized salt is the nutritional benefit of iodine.
